author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In blackened seas, the serpent dulls its gleam,
Demanding tribute, weighing down its worth,
With briny scales, dark spears extend full length,
Thus oil doth stagger, weep a cold lament.

Into the forge, the metals ever-wait,
While smoldering coals of crucial data sigh,
The anvils hush and fall to gravid still,
As all await Prometheus' touch of fate.

A rift froths wide, where once two giants stood,
He, clad in dollars, she in euros spun,
No thundercloud to blanket both o'er same,
In divergence, woven tapestry's new blood.

feedItems.title: Oil Set for Third Weekly Drop on Demand Fears
feedItems.description: Oil futures were close to 2% higher but remained on course for a third consecutive weekly decline as fears about demand have battered prices.

feedItems.title: Metals Steady Ahead of US Jobs Data
feedItems.description: Base metals and gold were largely unchanged ahead of the nonfarm payroll data, with investors looking to key economic indicators to see how the U.S. economy is faring amid rising interest rates.

feedItems.title: Growing Fed-ECB Divergence Boosts Case For Higher Euro Versus Dollar
feedItems.description: A growing divergence between the rate outlooks of the Fed and ECB “builds a stronger case for a significantly higher euro against the dollar,” Swissquote said.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Upon the eve when all was still,
Telecom Italia's lofty quills,
For bids they sought, but all in vain,
Their landline assets' worth to gain.

From KKR and Macquarie came,
Offers deemed not meet nor tame,
Now, till June the ninth they wait,
To seal their assets' fateful fate.

Upon a Thales' visage bright,
Higher sales give prophet's sight,
Berenberg spies strong year ahead,
With full year's blessings surely spread.

Hark! IAG in affluence fades,
Returns to profit's verdant glades,
Demand rebounds, swift earnings rise,
To prepandemic levels skies.

feedItems.title: Telecom Italia Seeks Higher Bids for Landline Assets
feedItems.description: Telecom Italia said nonbinding offers it has received for its fixed-network assets from KKR and from a Macquarie-led consortium aren’t adequate enough and it has given the parties until June 9 to submit final offers.

feedItems.title: Thales's Strong 1Q Bodes Well for the Year
feedItems.description: Higher sales and order intake for Thales show the aerospace-and-defense company is tracking slightly ahead of its guidance, a development that bodes well for the full year, Berenberg said.

feedItems.title: IAG Returns to Profit as Demand Rebounds
feedItems.description: IAG reported a surprise underlying profit of €9 million in the first quarter and raised its earnings guidance for the year on strong demand, with 2023 capacity seen at around 97% of prepandemic levels.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In realms where yield and bond entwine,
Eurozone, their dance increase in rate,
With gentle ECB's message, we find
Rabbits' leaps, interest to escalate.

Oh woeful tale of German forge,
The snail in dreary march doth fall,
With orders' tumble, downwards forge,
Through fears o'er global mount, appall.

Yet, to the field where Adidas dwells,
Hares rejoice, shares do climb their race,
Sales stand firm, if truth be quelled,
Inventories yield their small embrace.

feedItems.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Increase as More ECB Rate Rises to Come
feedItems.description: Eurozone government bond yields edged higher, reversing some of Thursday’s moves, as investors acknowledged the ECB’s message of more interest-rate rises.

feedItems.title: German Manufacturing Orders Tumble
feedItems.description: New orders at German factories fell by a worse-than-expected 10.7% in March after rising by a downwardly revised 4.5% in February, signaling sliding demand for goods as concerns over the health of the global economy mount.

feedItems.title: Adidas Shares Climb on Forecast-Beating Sales
feedItems.description: Shares in Adidas furthered their rally after the group said first-quarter organic sales remained stable on the year at €5.3 billion, and that high inventory levels have eased to some extent.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of Air France-KLM and their losses fair,
Narrow they seem, but expectations snare,
A lowered forecast doth their year forebode,
E'en though their tickets, like rich wine, be sold!

CaixaBank's profits ripe, they dost surmise,
A sum of eight-five-five, a grander prize,
With interest income, like ale stout, on high,
Their quarterly gains doth reach toward the sky.

Amongst the Orient's lands, U.S. firms stroll,
The threat of spying dramas takes its toll,
Their diligence walks a rope, twixt truth and threat,
In sanctions' wake, they doth their judgment set.

feedItems.title: Air France-KLM Cuts Capacity Target as First Quarter Falls Short
feedItems.description: Air France-KLM reported narrower losses in the first quarter but which fell short of expectations, and slightly lowered its capacity forecast for the year ahead despite strong ticket sales that lifted revenue.

feedItems.title: CaixaBank Profits Top Forecasts
feedItems.description: CaixaBank said its first-quarter net profit was €855 million, as net interest income rose 49%, helped by higher interest rates.

feedItems.title: U.S. Companies in China Worry Due Diligence Will End in Spy Dramas
feedItems.description: Foreign companies are walking a tightrope between their need for business intelligence to comply with U.S. sanctions and mounting concerns about the risks of carrying out due diligence.
